ranked_diseases.explanation: Ferguson-Smith disease is characterized by multiple self-healing squamous epitheliomas, which matches the patient's phenotypic feature.
This is another name for Ferguson-Smith disease, also characterized by self-healing squamous epitheliomas.
Keratoacanthoma, multiple is a related condition that can present with self-healing squamous epitheliomas, though less specific.
While primarily associated with basal cell carcinoma, some cases may present with self-healing lesions resembling squamous epitheliomas.
Xeroderma pigmentosum can lead to various skin neoplasms, including self-healing lesions, though it is less specific.
